a.title: SCHOOL MEAL UPDATES- Request form opens Friday morning / closes Monday at Noon
a.aria-label: SCHOOL MEAL UPDATES- Request form opens Friday morning / closes Monday at Noon

div.span: SCHOOL MEAL UPDATES- Request form opens Friday morning / closes Monday at Noon

img.alt: SCHOOL MEAL UPDATES- Request form opens Friday morning / closes Monday at Noon
img.div: GCS will distribute five-day student meal boxes on Wednesday, April 22. If you ordered and received meals on April 8 or 15 - no need to submit another order form. We will duplicate your order and distribute your meals to the same pick-up or delivery location. If you did not request meals for April 8 or 15 or need to make a change, please submit the online request form at greenbriercountyschools.org by noon on Monday, April 20. The form opens on Friday morning. No internet? Please leave a message at 304-968-9519. Pick-up locations, including MARVEL, Alvon UMC, Renick Fire Hall, Williamsburg Community Center, and elementary schools (except for Rupert Elementary), will be open from 3 - 5 p.m. on Wednesday, April 22. Deliveries made between 2:30 - 5:30 p.m. Direct link to form: http://ow.ly/SgLU50zaEdO

a.title: WV ESEA Waiver Request
a.div: The West Virginia Department of Education (WVDE) is posting the WVDE ESEA Waiver Request for assessment administration for public comment per the requirements of the United States Department of Education (USED). The waiver request is based on the state's decision to suspend statewide summative assessments, reporting, and accountability calculations for spring 2020. Click here to view the letter and provide public comment.

img.div:
Countrymen has installed some drive-up, free wi-fi at a few parking lots within our service area. These areas are:
• The State Fairgrounds in Fairlea- the paved parking lot near the tunnel
• Alumni Park parking lot in Alderson
• Williamsburg Volunteer Fire Dept parking lot (operational by mid-morning Friday)
The services will be available from 8am to 7pm.
In order to keep the drive-up service available, we all need to follow the state’s guidelines for social distancing. Please stay in your vehicles. Turn the vehicle in the direction of the wi-fi device in order to allow better signal. The service will turn off promptly at 7pm. This step was taken to ensure there wouldn’t be any reason for loitering in the parking lot after dark. If we have people remaining in the lots after dark, then we have added extra work to the police officers in the areas an

address.aria-label: Phone number for Greenbrier County Schools
Fax number for Greenbrier County Schools

span.data-emptytext: Greenbrier County Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value:
Greenbrier County Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment. GCS is also committed to making its electronic and information technologies accessible to individuals with disabilities in accordance with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act. We are in the process of auditing and remediating content as we strive to provide a fully accessible site.
Please direct inquiries regarding our non-discrimination policies, website accessibility, or requests for accessible /alternate documents or information to Title IX Coordinator, Nancy Hanna at 304-647-6470 / nhanna@k12.wv.us.
GCS provides an accessible web platform through its web host, SchoolBlocks. To learn more about SchoolBlocks accessibility appproach please go to http://www.schoolblocks.com/ada.html.
Website inquiries can also can be directed to Webmaster@GreenbrierCountySchools.org

p.span:
Greenbrier County Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment. GCS is also committed to making its electronic and information technologies accessible to individuals with disabilities in accordance with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act. We are in the process of auditing and remediating content as we strive to provide a fully accessible site.
Please direct inquiries regarding our non-discrimination policies, website accessibility, or requests for accessible /alternate documents or information to Title IX Coordinator, Nancy Hanna at 304-647-6470 / nhanna@k12.wv.us.
GCS provides an accessible web platform through its web host, SchoolBlocks. To learn more about SchoolBlocks accessibility appproach please go to http://www.schoolblocks.com/ada.html.
Website inquiries can also can be directed to Webmaster@GreenbrierCountySchools.org

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
